medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient appeared fatigued and was sleeping later than usual for 2 days prior to admission. An hour before admission, she fell, experienced generalized tonic-clonic movements which resolved spontaneously in less than 1 minute, and afterward exhibited confusion and somnolence.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of dementia, mild cognitive impairment diagnosed 5 years prior, possible Alzheimer's disease, past stroke with resolved expressive aphasia and weakness, chronic ptosis, strabismus, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and a pituitary adenoma.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of myocardial infarction at age 80, father died of stroke in his eighth decade, sister died of lung cancer at age 79; children are well.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with husband, required 24-hour care in recent months, worked in health care, smoked cigarettes for 50 years, minimal alcohol consumption.
